metadata.Title: CVE-2020-17507 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Qt through 5.12.9, and 5.13.x through 5.15.x before 5.15.1. read_xbm_body in gui/image/qxbmhandler.cpp has a buffer over-read.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-17507` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libqt5concurrent5 - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5core5a - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5dbus5 - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5gui5 - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5network5 - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5opengl5 - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5printsupport5 - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5sql5 - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5sql5-ibase - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5sql5-mysql - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5sql5-odbc - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5sql5-psql - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5sql5-sqlite - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5sql5-tds - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5test5 - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5widgets5 - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
libqt5xml5 - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
qt5-default - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
qt5-gtk-platformtheme - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
qt5-qmake - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
qt5-qmake-bin - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
qtbase5-examples - 5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qt4-x11: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
qtbase-opensource-src package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.5+dfsg-0ubuntu2.6').
